text: Drimys winteri (Winter's bark or canelo) is a Chilean tree from (Winteraceae). Drimys has six species, including D.andina, D.confertifolia, D.winteri, D fernandeziana JORDAN M.& RC PEÑA 2005 Drimys winterii J.R.ET FORSTER (WINTERACEAE) IN Muñoz O.et V.Fajardo Flora de Chile. Biología, Farmacología y Química ISBN 956-296-038-2 Rodríguez RA et al 2018 Catálogo and D. granatensis (Brazil) Eduardo Ruiz, Oscar Toro, Daniel J. Crawford, Tod F. Stuessy, María A. Negritto, Carlos Baeza & José Becerra PDF Pseudowintera is closed to them. Foikeulia razowskii, a species of Tortricidae, feeds on leaves of D.winteriUrra, F 2017 Revista Chilena de Entomología 43: 47-54 ==References== ==Other websites== * RUIZ, Eduardo et al. Phylogenetic relationships among Chilean species of Drimys (Winteraceae) based on its sequences and insertion/deletion events. Gayana Bot. [online]. 2008, vol.65, n.2 [citado 2019-07-08], pp.220-228.
